data.title: List of Famous Bands from Sacramento
data.meta_description: List of Sacramento bands, listed by their level of fame. This Sacramento musicians list includes both bands and solo artists. All famous Sacramento bands are ...
data.text:
List of Sacramento bands, listed by their level of fame. This Sacramento musicians list includes both bands and solo artists. All famous Sacramento bands are included, as well as many Sacramento musicians of underground status. This list of Sacramento musical artists includes information like what genre the artist falls under, what albums they've put out and more. If you want to know more about these famous Sacramento bands you can click on their names to learn more about them. Bands from every genre are listed here, including rock, pop, hip-hop/rap, jazz, and more.

This is a list that features bands like Deftones and Tesla.

If you're wondering, "What bands are from Sacramento?" or "What is a list of Sacramento bands?" then this list will answer your questions. {#nodes}

Ranked by

Nu metal, Rock music, Heavy metal

Albums : White Pony, Around the Fur, Change (In the House of Flies), Adrenaline, Diamond Eyes

Hailing from the vibrant music scene of Sacramento, the Deftones burst onto the alternative metal arena in the late '90s with their distinct fusion of heavy and atmospheric soundscapes. Their innovative mix of aggressive riffs, ethereal textures, and frontman Chino Moreno's emotional vocal delivery set them apart from their peers and cemented their status as one of the best bands from the city. Albums like White Pony and Diamond Eyes showcase their musical growth, pushing the boundaries of their genre while leaving an indelible mark on the hearts of fans worldwide. It's no wonder this dynamic band has garnered multiple platinum records and a dedicated following throughout their illustrious career.

Glam metal, Blues-rock, Rock music

Albums : Psychotic Supper, The Great Radio Controversy, Mechanical Resonance, Five Man Acoustical Jam, Forever More

Since forming in the mid-'80s, Tesla has been a driving force in the hard rock scene, proudly representing Sacramento with their no-nonsense approach to music. Often overlooked in favor of hair metal contemporaries, Tesla's authentic, bluesy style and relatable lyrics resonated with audiences craving substance over flash. Classics like "Modern Day Cowboy" and "Love Song" have stood the test of time, reflecting the enduring quality of this band's musicianship. With a reputation for electrifying live performances, Tesla remains a beloved hometown act with an impressive legacy.

Country rock, Post-grunge, Alternative rock

Albums : Fashion Nugget, Comfort Eagle, Prolonging the Magic, Motorcade of Generosity, Pressure Chief

Combining an array of influences like alternative rock, funk, and country, Cake is a true Sacramento treasure, known for their quirky style, witty lyrics, and unique instrumental arrangements. From their breakout single "The Distance" to fan-favorite tracks like "Short Skirt/Long Jacket," Cake's eclectic and playful sound continues to charm listeners with each new release. Fronted by the charismatic John McCrea, the band's distinctive vocal delivery and satirical undertones have solidified their place among the finest Sacramento exports. With a fiercely loyal fan base and a penchant for pushing creative boundaries, Cake remains an enduring gem in the city's musical landscape.

New Wave, Christian punk, Rock music

Albums : Eighty Eight, All Fall Down, Sticks and Stones, 123, Drowning With Land in Sight

The 77's, a seminal band in the Christian alternative rock scene, have been championing their faith through music while hailing from Sacramento since the early '80s. Their fusion of catchy hooks, introspective lyrics, and tight musicianship earned them a devoted following both within and outside the Christian community. Albums like All Fall Down and Sticks and Stones highlight the band's fearless exploration of themes related to spirituality, love, and personal struggles. For their enduring contributions to the Christian rock scene and their inimitable sound, The 77's are undeniably one of the most influential bands to come out of Sacramento.

Dance-punk, Alternative rock, Indie rock

Albums : Myth Takes, Louden Up Now, !!!, Take Ecstasy With Me / Get Up, Me and Giuliani Down by the School Yard (A True Story)

A testament to Sacramento's diverse music scene, !!! (pronounced "chk chk chk") stormed onto the indie rock circuit in the late '90s with their dance-punk sound and frenetic live shows. From their self-titled debut to critically acclaimed albums like Myth Takes, this eclectic collective has consistently captivated listeners with their irresistible grooves and infectious energy. Unafraid to push boundaries and experiment with new sounds, !!!'s genre-blending style has helped cement their status as pioneers in the post-punk revival movement. Their unique approach to music and uncompromising creativity makes them one of Sacramento's most distinctive and beloved acts.

Horror punk, New Wave, Punk blues

Albums : Stay Sick!, Smell of Female, Flamejob, How to Make a Monster, Psychedelic Jungle

As pioneers of psychobilly and purveyors of punk-infused rockabilly, The Cramps emerged from Sacramento's burgeoning music scene in the late '70s, armed with their distinctive blend of horror-inspired lyrics and thundering rhythms. Fronted by the enigmatic Lux Interior and Poison Ivy Rorschach, their theatrical live performances and provocative image became legendary in the underground scene. Albums such as Songs the Lord Taught Us and Stay Sick! showcase The Cramps' wild sonic concoctions, teetering between macabre and campy. With their unmistakable style and cult following, The Cramps have left an indelible mark on the history of punk rock and Sacramento's musical legacy.
